text: Lepetella sierrai is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Lepetellidae. This species is the host of the ectoparasitic copepod Lepetellicola brescianii Huys, Lopez Gonzalez, Roldan & Luque, 2002 ==Description== The shell grows to a size of 2.5 mm. ==Distribution== This marine species occurs from the Bay of Biscay to Madeira. ==References== * Gofas, S.; Le Renard, J.; Bouchet, P. (2001). Mollusca, in: Costello, M.J. et al. (Ed.) (2001). European register of marine species: a check-list of the marine species in Europe and a bibliography of guides to their identification. Collection Patrimoines Naturels, 50: pp. 180–213 Category:Lepetellidae Category:Gastropods described in 1994
title: Lepetella sierrai
